thread.title: Parking and shuttle information for FC Barcelona vs LA Galaxy at the Rose Bowl
thread.title_full: Parking and shuttle information for FC Barcelona vs LA Galaxy at the Rose Bowl

author: Don Simkovich, LA Business News Examiner
title: Parking and shuttle information for FC Barcelona vs LA Galaxy at the Rose Bowl
text:
Parking and shuttle information for FC Barcelona vs LA Galaxy at the Rose Bowl Use your key for the next article Comment Play The FC Barcelona squad arrived in Los Angeles on Sunday for the club's three-match tour of the United States. Arda Turan, Barca’s newest acquisition, Uruguayan striker Luis Suarez, Andres Iniesta, Spanish center back Gerard Pique, and other legends of ... on.aol.com 
If you're one of the 90,000 fans heading to the Rose Bowl on Tuesday to see the LA Galaxy take on FC Barcelona with an 8pm kickoff, then plan ahead to ride a shuttle or park. Don't try and wait until the last minute to arrive, park, and get to your seat right before the match gets underway. 
There's discounted parking for early arrivals and carpools, free shuttle rides, and offsite parking lots. 
Parking lots will be open beginning at 2 p.m. That's also when the International Champions Cup Fanfest begins. 
General parking is available for $30 in Rose Bowl Stadium lots, but will be discounted 50 percent to $15 for fans who arrive before 5 p.m. Please note that fans should plan to arrive well in advance of 5 p.m. for this special rate as there will be lines entering the lots. 
Additionally, fans who drive with four or more people in a vehicle will also receive the $15 discount while parking lots are available. 
The match for the International Champions Cup will be one of the largest crowds for a Rose Bowl stadium event this year. A release from the City of Pasadena says do not rely on your GPS for directions in to or out of the stadium. There will be temporary road closures and temporary no parking areas. 
No one freeway exit is better than another. 
To accommodate high demand, there will be adjacent off-site parking available in addition to FREE shuttle rides to and from the stadium. 
Shuttles leave from Parsons Engineering in Old Pasadena with parking available at Parsons parking lot on Fair Oaks Avenue and Walnut Street as well as in surrounding lots throughout Old Pasadena. 
Shuttles will run before, during and after the match, starting at 3 p.m. Shuttles will have their own dedicated route in and out of the stadium to avoid delays. Shuttles are free although parking charges may apply in Downtown Pasadena. 
Here's a summary of times: 
· 2 p.m. – Rose Bowl Stadium parking lots open 
· 2 p.m. – ICC FanFest Starts 
· 3 p.m. – Park & Ride shuttle lots open & buses begin running 
· 6 p.m. – Stadium gates open 
· 8 p.m. – Kickoff
